PATIENT_ID: TEST_SOLID_ORGAN_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-09 14:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-09 14:10:00
Category I activation for 30-year-old male. MVC with steering wheel impact
to abdomen. Blunt abdominal mechanism. Seatbelt sign present.
BP 94/58, HR 118, RR 22, GCS 15.
Hemodynamic instability on arrival. Abdominal tenderness diffuse.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-09 14:15:00
FAST exam positive. Free fluid in abdomen noted on initial survey.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-09 14:30:00
CT abdomen with contrast: splenic laceration, Grade III.
Injury grade confirmed: Grade 3.
Hemoperitoneum with free fluid in abdomen pelvis.
No splenic extravasation identified on initial scan.
Hemodynamic status: unstable requiring fluid resuscitation.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-09 14:45:00
Solid organ injury confirmed: splenic laceration Grade III.
Post-resuscitation hemodynamic status improving.
Hemodynamic stability achieved after 2L crystalloid and 2U pRBC.
Serial exams and repeat imaging planned.
No angiography indicated at this time given hemodynamic improvement.
Admitted to surgical ICU for non-operative management.
